properties.label: Cloud Ice
properties.description: Radiative properties of ice crystals in clouds

enum.label: Cloud Ice Properties
enum.description: Radiative properties of ice crystals in clouds

choices.label: mean projected area
choices.description: randomly oriented irregular ice crystals present a greater mean projected area than spheres

choices.label: bi-modal size distribution
choices.description: small mode diameters: a few tens of microns, large mode diameters: typically hundreds of microns

choices.label: ensemble of ice crystals
choices.description: complex shapes represented with an ensemble of symmetric shapes

choices.label: ice water path
choices.description: Integrated ice water path through the cloud kg m-2

properties.label: Cloud Liquid
properties.description: Radiative properties of liquid droplets in clouds

enum.description: Radiative properties of liquid droplets in clouds

choices.label: cloud droplet number concentration
choices.description: CDNC

choices.label: liquid water path
choices.description: Integrated liquid water path through the cloud kg m-2

choices.label: broadband reflectivity
choices.description: albedo

enum.description: Type of scheme used for longwave radiation parameterisation

enum.description: Method for the radiative transfer calculations used in the longwave scheme

choices.label: adaptive
choices.description: exploits spatial and temporal correlations in optical characteristics

choices.description: for particles that are much larger than the wavelength of light

properties.description: Pathways for the solar forcing of the atmosphere model domain

enum.label: Solar Forcing Pathways
enum.description: Pathways for solar forcing of the atmosphere

choices.label: precipitating energetic particles
choices.description: Precipitating energetic particles from the sun (predominantly protons) and the magnetosphere (predominantly electrons) affect the ionization levels in the polar middle and upper atmosphere, leading to significant changes of the chemical composition

choices.label: cosmic rays
choices.description: Cosmic rays are the main source of ionization in the troposphere and lower stratosphere.
